p: Log events associated with the logging subsystem, such as the beginning and the end of logging.
Log events such as the initialization of the logging subsystem to help detect when logs have been stopped to conceal malicious activity.
To log events associated with the logging subsystem:
ol:
Identify code used to start and stop logging. Make a spreadsheet of code that initializes, pauses, or stops logging. This code should naturally be a part of the logging subsystem itself, so it should be easy to find.
 Add code that generates log entries. To each piece of code that starts or stops logging, add code that generates log entries indicating that the logging subsystem has been started or stopped.
li: Identify code used to start and stop logging. Make a spreadsheet of code that initializes, pauses, or stops logging. This code should naturally be a part of the logging subsystem itself, so it should be easy to find.
Add code that generates log entries. To each piece of code that starts or stops logging, add code that generates log entries indicating that the logging subsystem has been started or stopped.
strong: Identify code used to start and stop logging.
Add code that generates log entries.

html:
What to Do

Log events associated with the logging subsystem, such as the beginning and the end of logging.

Why

Log events such as the initialization of the logging subsystem to help detect when logs have been stopped to conceal malicious activity.

How

To log events associated with the logging subsystem:

  1. Identify code used to start and stop logging. Make a spreadsheet of code that initializes, pauses, or stops logging. This code should naturally be a part of the logging subsystem itself, so it should be easy to find.
  2. Add code that generates log entries. To each piece of code that starts or stops logging, add code that generates log entries indicating that the logging subsystem has been started or stopped.
